column1:
Tier 0: Critical Infrastructure & Administration
Tier 1: Standard Employee & Productivity
Tier 2: Specialized & Transactional Systems
Tier 3: Facility & Support Infrastructure

column3: Dedicated, hardened physical or virtual workstations used exclusively for administrative tasks on Tier 0 infrastructure.
column4: Hardened Laptops, Yubikeys, Jump Hosts, Dedicated NICs.
column5: Zero-Trust Isolation: Removing internet/email access; enforcing hardware-root-of-trust.

column3: Specialized endpoints and terminals used for high-frequency, low-latency financial instrument trading and market data feeds.
column4: Trading Turrets, Bloomberg/Refinitiv Terminals, Direct Exchange Feeds.
column5: Micro-segmentation: Protecting trading integrity via network isolation and PTP time-security.

column3: Standard-issue hardware used by bank staff for day-to-day operations and internal data processing.
column5: UEM + XDR Baseline: Unified policy enforcement and real-time behavioral telemetry.

column3: Centralized desktop environments hosted in the data center or cloud, decoupled from physical hardware.
column4: Citrix, Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), Thin Clients, Zero Clients.
column5: Non-Persistence: Ephemeral instances that wipe session state and resident malware on logout.

column3: Cloud-delivered business productivity applications that house and process bank data.
column4: M365 (Teams, Outlook), SharePoint Online, OneDrive, SaaS Business Apps.
column5: Conditional Access: Dynamic access based on device health, identity risk, and geolocation.

column3: The primary software interface for the internet and SaaS; often the largest logical attack surface.
column4: Managed Edge/Chrome, Browser Extensions, Remote Browser Isolation (RBI).
column5: Extension Governance: Risk-based allow-listing and sandboxing high-risk web traffic via RBI.

column3: User-developed logic, scripts, and models used for complex financial analysis and decision-making.
column4: Excel VBA/Macros, Python/R scripts, Power Platform (Low-code/No-code).
column5: Logic Integrity: Code signing and automated scanning for macros to prevent "Shadow IT" risks.

column3: Automated software agents and "Bots" that interact with banking systems as digital workers.
column4: RPA Software Bots, Automated Service Agents, AI-driven Workers.
column5: Secret Vaulting: Securely managing non-human credentials via PAM and least-privilege scoping.

column3: Isolated environments for high-risk tasks like development or internal/contractor pentesting.
column4: In-house Red Team rigs, Contractor Laptops, Dev Sandboxes (Docker).
column5: Authorized Exception Zones: High-monitoring zones that permit "risky" tools while containing them.

column3: Public or staff-facing terminals used specifically for customer financial transactions.
column4: ATM, VTM, CDM, Teller Terminals, Kiosks, PIN Pads.
column5: Physical Resilience: Application Whitelisting (AppLocker) and physical port security.

column3: Regulatory-mandated capture and storage systems for trading and advisory communications.
column4: Call Recording Servers, Voice Management, Compliance Archive Storage.
column5: Immutability: WORM (Write Once Read Many) storage to ensure audit-proof non-repudiation.

column3: Systems facilitating real-time voice and video collaboration between staff and clients.
column4: IP Phones, Softphones, Video Conferencing (MTR/Zoom Rooms).
column5: Media Encryption: Enforcing end-to-end encryption for media streams to prevent eavesdropping.

column3: Networked non-PC devices used for building operations and physical security infrastructure.
column4: CCTV, NVR/DVR, Smart Lighting, HVAC Controllers, Meeting Room Panels.
column5: Visibility (NAC): Dynamic device profiling and VLAN assignment to prevent lateral movement.

column3: Network-connected hardware used for the physical-to-digital (and vice versa) document lifecycle.
column5: Data Hygiene: Secure release (MFA pull-printing) and automated HDD data shredding.

column3: Portable storage interfaces that bridge the physical gap between systems.
column4: Encrypted USBs, Hardware Security Keys, External SD Cards.
column5: DLP Policy: Global "Deny" policy with exception-based hardware-encrypted storage.

column3: Large-format collaborative displays used for internal planning and strategy meetings.
column5: Session Hygiene: Automated account logout and local cache clearing post-meeting.
